--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "M." <myoe112@...> wrote:
>
> "On the 3rd, 25 o=
r 26 men under Okita, Nagakura, Harada and others,
> were gathered in the m=
eeting hall of the Fushimi Magistrate's offices,
> and drinking good sake. =
Around 4 PM they saw Satsuma men rolling
> cannons into position around Gok=
omiya...."

**I wonder....

Okita, "Ummm this is some good sake it's making=
 me see things..."

Harada "Yeah I see cannons being moved around..."

Naga=
kura "Should we tell someone?"

Okita "If we told the Bakufu command would =
they care or listen to us?"

So I wonder if the "higher ups" were informed =
at all.  Or was it a wait 
and see game --- obviously the cannons illustrat=
ed Satsuma intent to 
use them (duh) but this description by Old Nagakura i=
s a bit weird.

It would be hilarious if he recorded all this in the third =
person

"M." <myoe112@...> wrote:
Some of us
> know the story of Nagakura b=
eing pulled up over a wall at
> Toba-Fushimi; apparently this is it. For th=
e longest time I thought it
> was a spear Shimada used, but apparently it w=
as a rifle.

mada 
Kai's spear too!
